cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW, then turning west, on track toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Texas coast near or just south of Corpus Christi

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire south-central Texas coastline from the Rio Grande delta northward to High Island, including Corpus Christi
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph with higher gusts) likely late Friday night into Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge and minor coastal flooding possible along the middle Texas coast including Corpus Christi Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches could trigger flash flooding in the Corpus Christi area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along area beaches
